page.title: 14BROAD OAK (CONT)
page.content: ,is mentioned in records dating back to 1293 . There are plans to flood the Broad Oak valley and build a reservoir. People are generally in favour, but the beautiful valley may be lost.Meanwhile the few old houses and farms remain boarded up. Facilities in Broad Oak are just about adequate for the local inhabitants, although there is one popular complaint about not having a bank.The facilities consist of :1 post office and general store, 1 hair dressers,2 public houses, 1 village hall,1 farm shop,2 farms offering "Pick Your Own"facilities, Countess of Huntingdon's,Connextion, & Chapel (Congregational).There is talk of a by-pass which has several suggested routes -but not many want it to go past where they live.If the by-pass is built many farmers will lose good land.
